page.title: 02THE TOWN CENTRE, BOURNE
page.content: The{Market Place}stands at the intersection of the A15 and A151 at the junction of North Street, West Street, South Street and Abbey Road. In the morning and evening it is very busy with vehicles and people commuting. On Thursdays and Saturdays there is a{street market. } The{Town Hall} with its clock dominates the crossing and the Court Sessions are held within. There are three{public houses;}the 19thC. Nag's Head, the Angel Hotel-an old coaching house and the oldest hotel in Bourne and The Burghley Arms, birthplace of William Cecil, Lord Burghley. All four main banks are to be found in the Market Place. The{Corn Exchange}is used as a public hall and the meeting place for the local Chamber of Trade. Outside, a shield bears the Bourne Coat of Arms.
